page.title: 02Chancellor's School
page.content: Chancellor's School is the local secondary school. It was opened in 1964 and takes in children mostly from Brookmans Park. In 1979 it became quite well known nationally as it was threatened with closure. A campaign was set up to fight the decision and after several months of argument it was allowed to remain open. It is called Chancellor's School after Sir Thomas Moore who was Chancellor to King Henry Vlll. He lived in the area in a mansion called Gobions or as it was then called Gubbins.Ruins of the house can still be seen in what is now an open area. The school emblem is a wig which is similar to that worn by the Chancellor.
